sentences.en: Businessmen he lectures to do not even know the rudiments of doctrine.
sentences.cn: 他传教的那些实业家们甚至不懂教条的基础知识.

sentences.en: He advised my attending certain places in London for the acquisition of rudiments as I wanted.
sentences.cn: 他建议我到伦敦某几个地方去见识见识,获得一点我所欠缺的入门知识.

sentences.en: He has just learned the rudiments of Chinese.
He mastered only the rudiments of geometry.
sentences.cn: 他仅仅掌握了几何的入门知识.

sentences.en: Here he had the opportunity of learning at least the rudiments of freestoneworking.
sentences.cn: 在这儿,他至少有机会学一学用自由砂石作原料而工作的初步知识.

sentences.en: I have mastered the rudiments of economics.
sentences.cn: 我已精通经济学的基本原理.

sentences.en: I taught myself the rudiments of printing.
sentences.cn: 我自学了印刷的基本知识.

sentences.en: Such studies have suggested that the rudiments of mathematics are mastered gradually with effort.
sentences.cn: 此类研究表明:数学基础是经过逐渐努力后掌握的.

sentences.en: Such studies have suggested that the rudiments of mathematics are mastered gradually, and with effort.
sentences.cn: 这类研究发现,数学的基础部分要通过努力才能逐渐掌握.

sentences.en: The student using this book has been exposed to the rudiments of bonding and structure.
sentences.cn: 使用这本书的学生已经接触过成键和结构的基本原理.

trans.tran_cn: 初步，入门，基本原理( rudiment的名词复数 )，雏形，萌芽，退化器官
trans.tran_en: the most basic parts of a subject, which you learn first
